result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl D Stanley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 3; straight time with the exception that if the defendant is employed at the time of revocation, he may have release for work.

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

***It is the Court's intention the credit for time served in this case be applied to the defendant's other pending case 15CM1063.***

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges (including the Domestic Abuse Assessment) during period of probation. Defendant to enter into a payment plan with the Department. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Court WAIVED DNA surcharge on COUNT 3 as it is part of a continuous event.
No possession of firearms. Court advised the defendant of the federal ban on firearms and that he may be subject to federal prosecution for a violation of this ban.
No contact with the victim or her place of residence or employment.
AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: COUNT 1; straight time with the exception that if the defendant is employed at the time of revocation, he may have release for work.

The defendant is non-compliant with Probation conditions.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 60 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC. 

IMPOSED BUT STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 09-22-15 Court order imposing 60 days of condition time
Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (60 days straight time).  rmm

As to COUNT 2-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Earl D Stanley in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Earl D Stanley in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 40. Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense does not object to Branch 25 hearing this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNTS 1 & 3-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.   rmm
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail motion by the state argued and denied by the Court.  Bail remains at $500.00.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Earl D Stanley not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DALLET.
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm
Signed and filed, No Contact Order/Firearems Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Antonia W.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Earl D Stanley
Current: 4520 N. 28th St., Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 06-04-2015)
Prior: 3214 North 15th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant Earl D Stanley in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Earl D Stanley in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Due to lower case pending (15CM1063), parties advised that this case is reassigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
